bibl.title: Letter from Carolyn H. Booth to Howard A. Kelly, October 14, 1907

div1.p: Booth writes to Kelly regarding efforts to secure a pension for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Carolyn H. Booth to Howard A. Kelly, October 14, 1907
div1.opener:
L
not ans
# 138 So. Kenilworth Ave
Oak Park Ill.
Oct 14-1907
Dear Dr Kelly:-
div1.p:
In your letter
of July 25th '07 regarding the
pension for Mr John R.
Kissinger, you asked me
to interest, if possible, any
Senator from Illinois.

I recently had an
interview with ex-Senator
Mason, and he has
promised me to personally
attend to the matter this
Ac
Ki
winter in Washington. He
will see Governor Bereridge of
Indiana regarding Mr
Kissinger and he says:-
“Mr Kissinger shall have his
pension of fifty-dollars a
month!

I am to furnish senator
Mason with a history of the
case by Dec 1st, and I would
be very grateful to you for
any additional word you
could send me.

Mr Kissinger is now
a member of our Shut-in
Society and I hope to call upon
him and Mrs Kissinger before
long. South Bend is not far
from Chicago.

Trusting for all success
from our united efforts
div1.closer: Very earnestly N.P. Carolyn H Booth. Mrs. H.W. Booth
